intro: Jatropha hernandiifolia, commonly known as the Brazilian jatropha, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features palmately lobed leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas. The plant is also noted for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
